biomes.name: Midgard
biomes.subtitle: The Tamed Ruin
biomes.postGlitchState: Agricultural heartland; most populous realm. Survivors have carved civilization from the ruins.

zones.name: The Greatwood
zones.description: Feral forest descended from curated pre-Glitch parks. Designer trees have gone wild—no longer pruned by automated systems, grown into dense, unpredictable wilderness.

zones.name: The Asgardian Scar
zones.description: Colossal impact crater where portions of the Asgard orbital arcology crashed during the Glitch. Epicenter of Runic Blight contamination in the realm.

zones.name: The Souring Mires
zones.description: Toxic wetlands draining industrial runoff from Jötunheim and Helheim through collapsed infrastructure channels. The water is poison. The soil is worse.

zones.name: The Serpent Fjords
zones.description: Poisoned coastlines where Hafgufa's Brood—leviathan descendants of pre-Glitch aquaculture experiments—patrol the shallows.

biomes.flavorQuote: The Wall is the soul of the Hold.

biomes.name: Svartalfheim
biomes.subtitle: The Dvergr Forges
biomes.postGlitchState: Lightless underground manufacturing complex; perpetual darkness broken only by sacred forges and trade illumination.

zones.name: The Bright Halls
zones.description: Upper trading halls with merchant stalls, administrative chambers, and the only sustained illumination in Svartalfheim. Dvergr artisans display their finest work under carefully maintained lumen arrays.

zones.name: The Black Veins
zones.description: Ancient mining tunnels with absolute darkness and obsidian veins. Without light sources, vision is completely blocked. The tunnels wind through compressed geological strata rich in rare minerals.

zones.name: Forge Core
zones.description: Sacred forges and crafting areas with intense magical flames. The heat is oppressive but the forgelight provides partial visibility. Master smiths work tirelessly at anvils that have burned since before The Glitch.

biomes.flavorQuote: In the dark, the hammer sings. In the forge, the world is remade.

biomes.name: Helheim
biomes.subtitle: The Gangrenous Gut
biomes.postGlitchState: Toxic waste reclamation facility consumed by biological corruption; gangrenous processing center of decomposition and decay.

zones.name: Upper Bile
zones.description: Surface processing chambers with bioluminescent molds and waste collection. The air is thick with toxic fumes that burn the lungs and corrode exposed metal.

zones.name: The Dissolution Pits
zones.description: Deep recycling vats with caustic chemical solutions and toxic mist. The concentration of pollutants here is lethal without protection. Equipment degrades rapidly in the corrosive atmosphere.

zones.name: Garm's Watch
zones.description: Fortified checkpoint and neutral transition zone between Svartalfheim and Helheim. Protective wards negate realm-specific environmental hazards, providing safe passage between the realms.

biomes.flavorQuote: The Gut digests all. Even hope.

biomes.name: Muspelheim
biomes.subtitle: The Eternal Meltdown
biomes.postGlitchState: Volcanic nightmare realm of eternal flames; extreme heat degrades equipment and accumulates fatigue.

zones.name: The Hearth Perimeter
zones.description: Outer ring of Muspelheim where explorers first encounter the heat. Rocky terrain with occasional lava flows visible in the distance. Breathable but searing air stabilizes around 85°C.

zones.name: The Slag Fields
zones.description: Intermediate zone of cooled and re-heating lava formations. Uneven terrain with dangerous lava pockets and unpredictable heat spikes. Temperature averages 130°C with eruption-driven fluctuations.

zones.name: Surtr's Furnace
zones.description: The molten core of Muspelheim — a massive cavern with active lava flows, extreme thermal radiation, and constant convection currents. The air itself burns at 200°C. Only fire-attuned beings survive long here.

biomes.flavorQuote: Everything burns. Even the stones weep fire.

biomes.name: Niflheim
biomes.subtitle: The Frozen Tomb
biomes.postGlitchState: Flash-frozen wasteland of lethal cold; equipment becomes brittle and fragile under extreme cryogenic exposure.

zones.name: The Frost Marches
zones.description: The outer reaches of Niflheim where cold is extreme but survivable. Rolling plains of packed snow and ice with pristine formations useful for crafting. Temperature stabilizes around -40°C.

zones.name: The Living Glacier
zones.description: Intermediate zone of active glacier formation with treacherous crevasses and shifting ice. Temperature averages -55°C with dangerous wind chill effects. Glacial cores contain ancient ice-attuned materials.

zones.name: Hvergelmir's Heart
zones.description: The frozen core of Niflheim — an enormous ice cavern housing the heart-spring of all cold. Temperature plunges to -80°C. The very air crystallizes and breath freezes instantly. Only ice-attuned beings endure.

biomes.flavorQuote: The cold does not kill. It preserves — forever.

biomes.name: Jötunheim
biomes.subtitle: The Industrial Graveyard
biomes.postGlitchState: Colossal graveyard of broken machinery and giant remains; GiantScale mechanics triple fall damage and physical effects.

zones.name: The Bone Yards
zones.description: Scattered remains of giant skeletons and broken mechanical parts. Entry-level zone with moderate navigation challenges across slippery bone surfaces and debris fields.

zones.name: Utgard's Shadow
zones.description: Massive iron and steel structures casting deep shadows. Corroded machinery dominates the landscape with treacherous platforms and falling debris hazards.

zones.name: The Grinding Hall
zones.description: Central chamber with colossal grinding mechanisms still partially operational. Extreme hazard density with active machinery, deafening noise, and unpredictable mechanical movements.

biomes.flavorQuote: The bones of giants grind beneath your feet. Everything here was built for something far larger than you.

biomes.name: Vanaheim
biomes.subtitle: The Overgrown Laboratory
biomes.postGlitchState: Abandoned magical research facility consumed by mutagenic botanical mutations; spore exposure causes cumulative Corruption.

zones.name: The Undergrowth
zones.description: Dense ground-level vegetation with massive root systems and initial spore exposure. Low to moderate spore density with 1x corruption multiplier.

zones.name: The Canopy Sea
zones.description: Dense aerial fungal cloud with floating platforms and extreme biological activity. Extreme spore density with 2x corruption multiplier — accelerated accumulation zone.

zones.name: Ymir's Roots
zones.description: Ancient root systems forming cavern walls with slow-moving biomass and ancient corruption sources. Moderate spore density with 1x corruption multiplier and elevated aetheric saturation.

biomes.flavorQuote: The green does not grow. It hunts.

environmentalConditions.description: The volcanic heat of Muspelheim sears exposed flesh and causes rapid dehydration.
Flash-frozen temperatures that cause rapid hypothermia and frostbite.
Industrial pollutants and biological decay create a poisonous miasma.
Fungal spores that cause cellular mutation and biological corruption.
Unstable reality warps perception and causes psychic damage.
Psychic radiation that accelerates Cognitive Paradox Syndrome progression.
Complete absence of natural light. All actions requiring sight have disadvantage.
Everything is 3-10x normal scale. Increased fall distances, oversized obstacles.
